intro: Becquerelia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored becquerelia, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking bi-colored flowers, which typically display a combination of white and yellow hues. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its fibrous, woody stems. Its leaves are usually ovate and covered in a fine, silky texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Becquerelia bicolor is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
